headline: Market Indexes Fight Back to Flat for the Day
summary: Markets were mostly flat for the day, aside from the small-cap Russell 2000, which gave back the majority of its +2% gains yesterday.

raw.headline: Market Indexes Fight Back to Flat for the Day
raw.summary: Markets were mostly flat for the day, aside from the small-cap Russell 2000, which gave back the majority of its +2% gains yesterday.

headline: 'Big Short' investor Burry turned more bullish on second quarter
summary: Michael Burry's Scion Asset Management ended the first quarter more bullish on companies across different sectors and geographies, a securities filing showed on Thursday, after betting against Chinese companies previously as the Trump administration considered imposing tariffs. Burry, known as the "Big Short" investor for his prescient calls ahead of the 2008 U.S. housing market crash, placed bets that benefit from a rise in share prices. The call options convey the right to buy shares at a set price in the future.

headline: Utz, Estée Lauder, MGP Ingredients, B&G Foods, and Beyond Meat Shares Are Falling, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks fell in the pre-market session after markets pulled back amid hotter-than-expected inflation data. The main concern for investors was the July Producer Price Index (PPI), a measure of wholesale inflation. The higher-than-expected reading suggests that companies could face squeezed profit margins due to rising costs. This also reduces the likelihood of the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates, which could further dampen economic activity. Compounding these inflation fears are
